text:
Sonia watched him with wide, terrified eyes. 

“Have you guessed?” he whispered.

“Good God!” she cried, collapsing onto the bed. 

She buried her face in the pillows. 

Moments later, she sprang up and grabbed his hands. 

Her fingers trembled as she searched his face. 

Hope flickered in her gaze, then vanished. 

She knew it was true. 

“Why?” she thought, remembering how she sensed it all along.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia experiences a profound and paralyzing fear as she confronts the truth of Raskolnikov's actions.
